main event: Radar operators at Kelly Air Force Base, Texas tracked 1-3 unidentified objects on radar for approximately 1 hour and 50 minutes on January 14, 1954.
interesting points: The objects were estimated to be traveling at speeds between 222-622 miles per hour in a radius of 35 miles.
The objects joined together for approximately 3 minutes before separating with a definite heading and disappearing when a local aircraft was in the area, only to reappear after the aircraft departed.
The radar operators reported the objects as a solid blip on the scope and they remained on the scope for the entire duration of the sighting.
The sighting occurred in overcast conditions with fog and rain, but the weather was not deemed to be a factor in the observations.
No sound, trail, or smoke was associated with the objects, and they made no general motion to the southeast.
